title: Kalista's dash speed is affected by slows
body:
Just saying because it looks like nobody is aware of it.

To clarify: It means the speed of her dash get's slower when she is slowed and no, that's not normal. No other dash get's slowed down through cc.

replies.body: Usually dashes dont get slower when you are slowed. Kalista's is the only one that I know of. Also people keep saying slows dont affect her. That's wrong.

Kalista's passive's the dash most affected by slows certainly. Some other dashes do get their speed modified based off the users movement speed at time of cast as well though (in contrast to Kalista, who will dash slower if slowed, but won't dash faster if hasted). Examples of that include Shen's E  and Corki's W.

I just have one thing I want to bring up that I still don't understand; why does she dash at all?  It's hard to imagine that during development you guys thought "This can't possibly be a problematic champion, and this passive is definitely balanced for an ADC."

What do you think about my idea to have her dash **distance** reduced by slows? The greater the slow %, the greater the distance-reduction.

I think this would be a very interesting mechanic to help combat mobility creep in general.

It could, however, just be a special-case for her being that her passive gives her overloaded kiting potential.

I also love how Veigar's box now stops dashes in their tracks, another good mechanic to begin incorporating more.

Maybe Jarvan's wall can't be dashed over or Thresh' box stops dashes too (or reduces their max-distance based on the slow % like with the top suggestion).

Maybe, just maybe Flash gets turned into a dash instead of a blink so it has more, wait for it, counterplay.

I think those special cases need to be communicated better. For example I wasn't aware of the Corki and Shen case because I don't play them too often myself.
Maybe that way people would think of better counterpicks to Kalista. Personally I fear the day when I have to go up against a support Nunu as Kalista.
{{champion:157}} Sweeping Blade too. I think it's because they would make the champ in question impossible to kill for champs like Olaf who have MS slows but no gapclosers.

It's also effected by stuns and all other movement handicapping forms of CC. 

What's your point?
